poem:
**A World of Summits**  

The echoing halls of power  
where voices rise like wind,  
whispered in the ear of history.  
Between the map's folds,  
men dreaming of empires,  
journey from summit to summit,  
their discourse, a fragile bridge  
across abysses of silence.  
Yet watch how shadows lengthen,  
and truth, a bird on the wing,  
remains ever distant.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Zelenskyy to meet Trump on Monday after Putin summit briefing Ukraine’s president has said he will fly to Washington on Monday to meet Donald Trump after an hour long call with the US president in which he was briefed on the key points of the Alaska summit. Next week’s meeting will mark the first return to the White House for Volodymyr Zelenskyy since his infamous row with Trump and the vice-president, JD Vance, in the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
